triples.name: Cardiovascular disease
triples.relevance: The paper addresses heart disease prediction, which is a cardiovascular health problem requiring diagnostic classification.

triples.name: Feature selection
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and evaluates multiple feature selection methods combined with classification algorithms for optimal model performance.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning techniques form the foundation for the paper's approach to heart disease prediction and diagnosis.

triples.name: Principal component analysis
triples.relevance: PCA is one of the four feature selection methods evaluated in the paper for creating distinctive feature sets.

triples.name: Chi-squared test
triples.relevance: Chi-squared testing is one of the feature selection methods used, and ultimately performs best when combined with BayesNet.

triples.name: Relief (feature selection)
triples.relevance: ReliefF is one of the four feature selection methods evaluated in the paper for feature ranking and selection.

triples.name: Bayesian network
triples.relevance: BayesNet is the classification algorithm that achieved the best performance (85% accuracy) when combined with Chi-squared feature selection.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: Classification algorithms are central to the paper's approach of predicting heart disease outcomes from selected features.

triples.name: Computer-aided diagnosis
triples.relevance: The paper aims to improve the accuracy of computer-aided diagnosis systems for heart disease using machine learning and feature selection.
